videoSnippet.title: Before Beth Harmon, There Was Vera Menchik!
videoSnippet.description:
Read more about Vera Menchik chess club here https://www.chesshistory.com/winter/extra/menchikclub.html

New Channel here https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCVGy0TLDdeXszpqJw7FhJQ/
Email where you can contact me regarding the other channel: excellentsubscribers@gmail.com

Vera Menchik vs Jose Raul Capablanca
Karlsbad (1929), Karlsbad CSR, rd 7, Aug-07
Indian Game: Pseudo-Queen's Indian. Marienbad System (A47)

1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Bg2 c5 5. c4 cd4 6. O-O Qc7 7. Qd4 Nc6 8. Qf4 e5 9. Qd2 e4 10. Ng5 Ne5 11. Nc3 Nc4 12. Qd4 d5 13. b3 Bc5 14. Nb5 Qc6 15. Qc3 Qb5 16. bc4 Qc4 17. Qe5 Kf8 18. Bf4 Qa4 19. Rfd1 Qe8 20. Qb2 h6 21. Nh3 Ng4 22. Rac1 Bc6 23. e3 Kg8 24. Qe2 f5 25. f3 Nf6 26. g4 ef3 27. Bf3 fg4 28. Bg4 Qg6 29. Nf2 h5

The fourth international master chess tournament to be held in the spa resort of Karlsbad, Czechoslovakia in 1929 was a round robin event involving 22 of the best chess masters in the world. Of the top players, only world champion Alexander Alekhine and former world champion Emanuel Lasker were missing. The line up of players included such names as Jose Capablanca, Efim Bogoljubov, Frank Marshall, Akiba Rubinstein, Milan Vidmar, Aron Nimzowitsch, and Rudolf Spielmann. Among the remaining invitations, one notable participant was Vera Menchik, the women's world champion, who joined despite the protests of some male colleagues, including fellow participant Albert Becker. The tournament was held in the Kurhaus Imperial Hotel from July 30 to August 28. The time control used was 30 moves in two hours followed by 15 moves in one hour. Despite Spielmann's amazing beginning of 9 points earned in the first ten rounds followed by Capablanca's shared lead in the standings from the thirteenth round on, it was to be Nimzowitsch's "finest hour," with a win over Savielly Tartakower propelling him to first place and the grand prize of 20,000 Kronen. 

Second game:

Vera Menchik vs Max Euwe
"Looks Like I Struck An Euwe" (game of the day Aug-26-2019)
Hastings (1931/32), Hastings ENG, rd 2, Dec-29
Slav Defense: Czech. Lasker Variation (D18)

1. d4 d5 2. c4 c6 3. Nf3 Nf6 4. Nc3 dc4 5. a4 Bf5 6. e3 Na6 7. Bc4 Nb4 8. O-O e6 9. Ne5 Bd6 10. Qe2 c5 11. Bb5 Ke7 12. e4 Bg6 13. Ng6 hg6 14. e5 cd4 15. Rd1 Bc7 16. ef6 gf6 17. g3 a6 18. Be3 Bb6 19. Bc4 Kf8 20. Ne4 Kg7 21. Rac1 Rh5 22. Bf4 e5 23. g4 Rh8 24. Bg3 Qe7 25. Nd2 Rhe8 26. Qe4 Qd7 27. Nf3 Qc6 28. Qc6 Nc6 29. Bd5 Rac8 30. Be4 Rc7 31. Ne1 Rec8 32. Nd3 Ne7 33. Rc7 Rc7 34. Kf1 Rc4 35. Bb7 Ra4 36. Rc1 g5 37. f3 Ra2 38. Be1 a5 39. Bd2 f5 40. gf5 a4 41. Ke1 a3 42. b4 Kf6 43. Ba6 g4 44. Bc4 Rd2 45. Kd2 gf3 46. Nc5 Kf5 47. Bf7 Bd8 48. Be6 Kf6 49. Bg4 Nd5 50. Bf3 Nb4 51. Be4 Be7 52. Nd3 Na2 53. Rc6 Kg5 54. Rg6 Kh4 55. Ne5 Nc3 56. Kd3
